chargeHist.descr: Possession of Narcotic Drugs, Second and Subsequent Offense

result.execSummary:
The defendant Kody T. Peterson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.
Defendant to obtain and maintain full time employment, unless medically excused by a treating physician.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician. The defendant is to have NO CONTACT with Levi Stewart.
Defendant is to comply with any rules/recommendations as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.   DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed.
Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

ADDRESS INFO for Kody T. Peterson
Current: PO Box 661, Dodge Correctional Institution, Waupun, WI 53963 United States  (Effective: 12-29-2016)
Prior: 2609 Kesting Ct, Appleton, WI 54911 United States
From Michelle Peterson-VerBruggen to Court

10:05 am cases called-15CF49 & 16CF12. Defendant Kody T. Peterson in court with attorney Jonathan Thomas Groh.  Defendant Kody T. Peterson in custody.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Revocation Order and Warrant received by both counsel-corrections added to record by Attorney Groh. No corrections or material additions by DA Blader. Sentencing argument by DA Blader. Sentencing argument by Attorney Groh.  No statement by defendant prior to sentencing. Court makes statement prior to sentencing. Court sentences the defendant to: 15CF49 on Each count-3 years WSP to be served as 18 mo IC & 18 mo ES. Concurrent to each other and concurrent to any other sentence. 239 days credit for time served. CONDITIONS: AODA and follow through,   The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician. Terms of Agent. Costs re-imposed to be paid within 60 days or payment plan. 16CF12- 3 years WSP to be served as 18 mo IC & 18 mo ES, consecutive to 15CF 49 & 12CF13. Credit for 169 days for time served. CONDITIONS: AODA and follow through,   The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician. Terms of Agent. Costs re-imposed to be paid within 60 days or payment plan. Court finds defendant eligible for CIP & SAP. Appeal Rights Given.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on December 21, 2016 at 10:15 am.

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: 11:27 pm case called. Defendant Kody T. Peterson in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Agreement reached and stated on the record by DA Blader. Attorney Szilagyi concurs.   Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea: No Contest to Count 1.  Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Court dismisses outright second and subsequent repeater enhancer on Count 1. Court dismisses and reads-in Count 2. No statement by defendant. Court sentences the defendant to: SWD and places on probation for a period of 2 years. Credit for 1 days served. CONDITIONS:   The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician. AODA & follow through. Employment. No Contact with Levi Stewart. Costs to be paid within 60 days or payment plan. DNA Sample and Surcharge ordered by the Court.  Defendant advised of right to expunge DNA record through the Department of Justice. Appeal Rights Given.
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 12, 2016 at 11:15 am.
Granted by the Court

Status conference at 02-29-2016 02:05 pm

1:53 pm case called. Defendant Kody T. Peterson in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Preliminary Hearing and Time Limits discussed. Defendant wishes to waive preliminary hearing. Court questions defendant and accepts waiver of preliminary hearing. Court has read the complaint, finds probable cause and enters an order binding the defendant over for trial.   Information filed. Attorney Szilagyi confirms receipt, waives formal reading and enters pleas of Not Guilty.  STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Status conference scheduled for February 29, 2016 at 02:05 pm.
